title: Primo Levi - Short Stories & Memoirs (4 books)
description:
PRIMO LEVI (1919 - 1987) was an Italian Jewish chemist and writer.  He was the author of two novels and several collections of short stories, essays, and poems.

His best-known works include IF THIS IS A MAN [1947] (also published in the U.S. as "Survival in Auschwitz"), an account of the year he spent as a prisoner in the Auschwitz concentration camp in Nazi-occupied Poland; and his unique memoir and collection of short stories, THE PERIODIC TABLE [1975], which the Royal Institution of Great Britain named the best science book ever written.

Rounding out this collection are two posthumous short story collections, A TRANQUIL STAR [2007] and THE MAGIC PAINT [2011].


All the following are in EPUB format (IF THIS IS A MAN is in PDF):

* A TRANQUIL STAR: Unpublished Stories (Penguin, 2007).  Translated by Ann Goldstein and Alessandra Bastagli.

* IF THIS IS A MAN (Orion, 1959).  Translated by Stuart Woolf. [PDF copy - Also published in the U.S. as "Survival in Auschwitz", below]

* THE MAGIC PAINT (Penguin, 2011).  Translated by Ann Goldstein, Alessandra Bastagli, and Jenny McPhee.

* THE PERIODIC TABLE (Schocken, 1984).  Translated by Raymond Rosenthal.

* SURVIVAL IN AUSCHWITZ: The Nazi Assault on Humanity (Touchstone, 1996).  Translated by Stuart Woolf.
